definition: knot/sturdy/bond/to tie/to bind/to check out (of a hotel)
(of a plant) to produce (fruit or seeds)/Taiwan pr. [jie2]
to link/to join/to connect/continuously/in succession/including/(used with 也[ye3], 都[dou1] etc) even/company (military)
to tie the knot (idiom)/to get married

sentences.english: Bob and Mary will tie the knot next year after years of dating.
sentences.chinese: 鲍伯和玛莉交往多年后，明年将共结连理。

sentences.english: You need to begin connecting to other Hearts in order to get the upgrades.
sentences.chinese: 你还需要与其他的心相结连，才能升华。

sentences.english: For me, the highlight of the book was when the two main characters got married.
sentences.chinese: 对我来说，本书最精彩的部分是两位主角共结连理时。

sentences.english: When young people marry, they have just a small idea about what a marriage is all about.
sentences.chinese: 当一对年轻人共结连理时，对婚姻知之甚少。

sentences.english: The knot, to wish happiness with.
sentences.chinese: 喜结连理日，恭祝幸福随。

sentences.english: Do you think they are really happy to get married or is it supposed to be a speculation?
sentences.chinese: 认为他们是喜结连理，或是有意的“炒作”？
他们俩在2006年6月共结连理。

sentences.english: Norrington: Our destinies have been entwined, Elizabeth…but never joined.
sentences.chinese: 我们命运交缠，伊丽莎白，但无缘结连理。

definition: to associate with/to mix with/to connect
forced submission/to exploit advantage to force sb to do one's bidding
to break an agreement/to go back on one's word/to fail to keep one's promise
to dispatch troops/to send an army/to mobilize forces
refers to the Yellow Turbans Peasant Uprising at the end of later Han (from 184)
